docs.snippet: PITTSBURG, Penn., May 10. -- One of the distinct changes in the method of doing business in the sale of iron and steel has been that of holding buyers to their contracts. In former years, when an order was placed, the buyer took the liberty of...
docs.lead_paragraph: PITTSBURG, Penn., May 10. -- One of the distinct changes in the method of doing business in the sale of iron and steel has been that of holding buyers to their contracts. In former years, when an order was placed, the buyer took the liberty of canceling the contract at pleasure. Since the decline of business last year the producers have refused to accept cancellations.

headline.main: THE STEEL TRADE POSITION.; Keeping Buyers to Contracts Promises Litigation -- Tin Plate Mills Busy. ARGENTINA SENDS US OATS. Cargo Brought in Last Week Profitable Despite Duty.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 24. -- The United States Senate has at this session placed its approval on thirty-seven treaties -- a greater number than were ratified during the twenty years preceding this year.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 24. -- The United States Senate has at this session placed its approval on thirty-seven treaties -- a greater number than were ratified during the twenty years preceding this year.
docs.abstract: Sen, during current session, approves 37 treaties; 12 nations agree to arbitrate future disputes with US

headline.main: 37 TREATIES RATIFIED.; Great Gain for International Arbitration Wrought by the Senate.

docs.snippet: LA PAZ, Bolivia, July 9. -- Further details received here of the revolution in Paraguay state that while fighting was going on in Asuncion an incident occurred which might have had a most serious result. The American Minister, Edward C. O'Brien,...
docs.lead_paragraph: LA PAZ, Bolivia, July 9. -- Further details received here of the revolution in Paraguay state that while fighting was going on in Asuncion an incident occurred which might have had a most serious result. The American Minister, Edward C. O'Brien, desirous of proffering his good offices in order to prevent further loss of life, while approaching the headquarters of the revolutionists was fired upon three times by Government troops.
docs.abstract: US Min reptd nearly shot by revolutionaries in Asuncion

headline.main: FIRE ON MINISTER O'BRIEN.; America's Representative Shot at by Paraguayan Troops.

docs.snippet: BERLIN, July 18. -- Close upon the heels of "Banzai," which depicted the "coming war" between America and Japan, another book has made its appearance in Germany, which plunges the United States into a bloody and inglorious conflict with the "triple...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, July 18. -- Close upon the heels of "Banzai," which depicted the "coming war" between America and Japan, another book has made its appearance in Germany, which plunges the United States into a bloody and inglorious conflict with the "triple alliance" of Brazil, Argentina, and Chile, which ends in the annihilation of the Monroe doctrine and the collapse of North American "influence" over the Latin republics.

headline.main: PICTURES US AT WAR WITH SOUTH AMERICA; German Author Has Our Army Beaten in Decisive Battle at Buenos Ayres. JAPAN SEIZES OPPORTUNITY Declares War and Destroys Naval Base at Manila -- Then Europe Intervenes to Check Yellow Peril.

byline.original: Foreign Correspondence THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PARIS, Aug. 9. -- Two subjects of preoccupation presented themselves this week to the attention of the Paris Bourse. In consequence, however, of the tightness of the market, they have had precisely the opposite effect to that which might have been...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Aug. 9. -- Two subjects of preoccupation presented themselves this week to the attention of the Paris Bourse. In consequence, however, of the tightness of the market, they have had precisely the opposite effect to that which might have been logically expected.
docs.abstract: Mineral wealth of Brit Empire reptd

headline.main: PARIS BOURSE PRICES FIRM.; Ottoman Stocks Kept Well Up During the Week.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 18. -- Much interest is shown in this city in the announcement of the wedding of Capt Benjamin D. Manton of Colonia, Uruguay, and Miss Sara E. Hartman of this city at Fall River on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 18. -- Much interest is shown in this city in the announcement of the wedding of Capt Benjamin D. Manton of Colonia, Uruguay, and Miss Sara E. Hartman of this city at Fall River on Friday.

headline.main: BRIDE FROM PHILADELPHIA.; Miss Hartman Is a Magazine Writer and an Extensive Traveler.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WORCESTER, Mass., Oct. 18. -- "Married -- Manton-Hartman, in Fall River, Oct. 16, 1908, by the Rev. John Hartman, Capt. Benjamin D. Manton, Colonia, Uruguay, and Miss Sarah Hartman, Philadelphia."
docs.lead_paragraph: WORCESTER, Mass., Oct. 18. -- "Married -- Manton-Hartman, in Fall River, Oct. 16, 1908, by the Rev. John Hartman, Capt. Benjamin D. Manton, Colonia, Uruguay, and Miss Sarah Hartman, Philadelphia."

headline.main: CAPT. MANTON AT 80 WEDS IN SECRET; United States Consul at Colonia, Uruguay, Takes Sarah Hartman, Aged 43, as Bride. IGNORES FAMILY PROTESTS Couple Disappear After Marriage at Fall River -- Said to Have Settled $100,000 on His Fourth Wife.
